definition: to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: Odds have evened between the champions.
sentences.chinese: 爭奪冠軍的兩名選手得勝的機會均等。

sentences.english: The natives have been warring over this small piece of land without either side winning.
sentences.chinese: 土人一直在爭奪這一小片土地，雙方相持不下。

sentences.english: The discovery also reveals how male squid compete for female mating partners.
sentences.chinese: 這一發現也揭示了雄性烏賊如何爭奪交配伴侶的。

sentences.english: Two very drunk men were fighting over the only girl there.
sentences.chinese: 兩個醉漢爲了爭奪那裏唯一的女孩大打出手。

sentences.english: Growing numbers of people would be vying for limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增長將爭奪有限的資源。

sentences.english: Yet fights over water have also led to dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 不過，爭奪水源的戰鬥也導致了對話。

sentences.english: Players jostle and collide realistically while trying to win balls.
sentences.chinese: 球員們在爭奪球時真實地拼搶。

sentences.english: The winners of each section nationwide will then fight for the overall title of champions.
sentences.chinese: 國內各個分區賽的冠軍隨後將展開全國冠軍的爭奪。

sentences.english: The manipulation of gas supplies has become a weapon in this contest.
sentences.chinese: 在這場爭奪中，操縱燃氣供應成爲了一件有利武器。

sentences.english: The soldiers contested every inch of ground.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們爲爭奪每一寸土地而鬥爭。

sentences.english: Those politicians are jockeying for power.
sentences.chinese: 那些政客們正在相互排擠以爭奪權力。

sentences.english: Farmers and herders came into conflict over land and water.
sentences.chinese: 農民和牧民爲爭奪土地和水資源而發生衝突。

sentences.english: Tigger raced with his friends for first prize.
sentences.chinese: 跳跳虎和他的朋友賽跑，爭奪第一名。

sentences.english: A. We tend to run meetings a bit like a food fight here at CCMP.
sentences.chinese: 我們在CCMP開會有點像食物爭奪戰。

sentences.english: The direct causation is the fighting for the Chanyu's heirdom.
sentences.chinese: 爭奪單于繼承權的鬥爭直接導致了匈奴的分裂。

sentences.english: Having struggled for ten days,he won the champion.
sentences.chinese: 經過十天的激烈爭奪，他最終取得了冠軍。

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
